    5138 +    2741 +    335 +     91 +  async getThemeCSS(themeName, customTheme) {
    5139 +    2742 +    336 +     92 +    if (themeName === 'custom' && customTheme) {
    5140 +    2743 +    337 +     93 +      let css = ':root {\n';
    5141 +    2744 +    338 +     94 +      Object.entries(customTheme).forEach(([prop, val]) => {
    5142 +    2745 +    339 +     95 +        css += `    ${prop}: ${val};\n`;
    5143 +    2746 +    340 +     96 +      });
    5144 +    2747 +    341 +     97 +      css += '}';
    5145 +    2748 +    342 +     98 +      return css;
    5146 +    2749 +    343 +     99 +    }
    5147 +    2750 +    344 +    100 +
    5148 +    2751 +    345 +    101 +    try {
    5149 +    2752 +    346 +    102 +      const response = await fetch(`themes/${themeName}.css`);
    5150 +    2753 +    347 +    103 +      if (!response.ok) throw new Error('Theme load failed');
    5151 +    2754 +    348 +    104 +      return await response.text();
    5152 +    2755 +    349 +    105 +    } catch (e) {
    5153 +    2756 +    350 +    106 +      console.error('Failed to load theme CSS', e);
    5154 +    2757 +    351 +    107 +      return ''; // Fallback
    5155 +    2758 +    352 +    108 +    }
    5156 +    2759 +    353 +    109 +  }

    5266 +    2869 +      4 +
    5267 +    2870 +      5 +### PDFService (PDF Export)
    5268 +    2871 +      6 +- **Status:** ‚ö†Ô∏è Resolved Rendering Issue
    5269 +    2872 +      7 +- **Issue:** The `html2pdf` library (specifically `html2canvas`) crashed when parsing modern CSS `color-mix()` functions used in the UI (Glassmorphism).
    5270 +    2873 +      8 +- **Fix:** Refactored `style.css` to use solid color variables (`var(--bg-secondary)`) instead of `color-mix()` for elements involved in the export context (Buttons).
    5271 +    2874 +      9 +- **Quality:**
    5272 +    2875 +     10 +  - ‚úÖ Clean separation of config (`buildHtml2PdfConfig`) and execution.
    5273 +    2876 +     11 +  - ‚úÖ Robust validation of user inputs (margins, page size).
    5274 +    2877 +     12 +  - ‚ö†Ô∏è Dependency on global `html2pdf` (should be modular, but acceptable for this architecture).
    5275 +    2878 +     13 +
    5276 +    2879 +     14 +### HTMLService (HTML Export)
    5277 +    2880 +     15 +- **Status:** ‚úÖ NEW Implementation
    5278 +    2881 +     16 +- **Issue:** Previous implementation was monolithic (inside `script.js`) and produced broken HTML (missing math styles, missing syntax highlighting dependencies).
    5279 +    2882 +     17 +- **Fix:** Created dedicated `HTMLService.js`.
    5280 +    2883 +     18 +  - Injects `katex.min.css` (CDN) for Math support.
    5281 +    2884 +     19 +  - Injects `prism-tomorrow.min.css` (CDN) for Code highlighting.

    5284 +    2887 +     22 +  - ‚úÖ Service-based architecture.
    5285 +    2888 +     23 +  - ‚úÖ Generates standalone HTML blobs.
    5286 +    2889 +     24 +
    5287 +    2890 +     25 +## 2. Architectural Review
    5288 +    2891 +     26 +
    5289 +    2892 +     27 +### Service Layer
    5290 +    2893 +     28 +- **Pattern:** The application uses a "Service Class" pattern (`PDFService`, `MermaidService`, `HTMLService`) instantiated in the main controller (`script.js`).
    5291 +    2894 +     29 +- **Verdict:** Good. This keeps logic out of the global scope and allows for easier testing/mocking.
    5292 +    2895 +     30 +- **Recommendation:** `script.js` acts as a text-heavy "God Controller". Future refactoring should split `script.js` into `EditorController`, `PreviewController`, and `ToolbarController`.
    5293 +    2896 +     31 +
    5294 +    2897 +     32 +### CSS / Styling
    5295 +    2898 +     33 +- **Architecture:** CSS Variables (`:root`) used for Theming.
    5296 +    2899 +     34 +- **Issue:** Modern CSS (`color-mix`) caused compatibility issues with legacy tools (`html2canvas`).
    5297 +    2900 +     35 +- **Lesson:** When building "Export to PDF" features that rely on DOM parsing, avoid bleeding-edge CSS in exportable elements.
    5298 +    2901 +     36 +
    5299 +    2902 +     37 +## 3. UI/UX Review
    5300 +    2903 +     38 +

    5640 +    3243 +     92 +  /**
    5641 +    3244 +     93 +   * Helper to retrieve CSS content
    5642 +    3245 +     94 +   * @private
    5643 +    3246 +     95 +   */
    5644 +    3247 +     96 +  async getThemeCSS(themeName, customTheme) {
    5645 +    3248 +     97 +    if (themeName === 'custom' && customTheme) {
    5646 +    3249 +     98 +      let css = ':root {\n';
    5647 +    3250 +     99 +      Object.entries(customTheme).forEach(([prop, val]) => {
    5648 +    3251 +    100 +        css += `    ${prop}: ${val};\n`;
    5649 +    3252 +    101 +      });
    5650 +    3253 +    102 +      css += '}';
    5651 +    3254 +    103 +      return css;
    5652 +    3255 +    104 +    }
    5653 +    3256 +    105 +    const baseUrl = import.meta.env.BASE_URL || '/';
    5654 +    3257 +    106 +    // Remove leading slash from baseUrl if present to avoid double slash with themes/
    5655 +    3258 +    107 +    // Actually relative fetch is best.
    5656 +    3259 +    108 +
    5657 +    3260 +    109 +    try {
    5658 +    3261 +    110 +      // Use relative path which works best with <base> or current location
    5659 +    3262 +    111 +      const response = await fetch(`themes/${themeName}.css`);
    5660 +    3263 +    112 +
    5661 +    3264 +    113 +      let finalResponse = response;
    5662 +    3265 +    114 +      if (!response.ok) {
    5663 +    3266 +    115 +        // Fallback to full path construction if relative failed
    5664 +    3267 +    116 +        const fullPath = `${baseUrl}themes/${themeName}.css`.replace('//', '/');
    5665 +    3268 +    117 +        finalResponse = await fetch(fullPath);
    5666 +    3269 +    118 +        if (!finalResponse.ok) throw new Error(`Theme load failed: ${finalResponse.status}`);
    5667 +    3270 +    119 +      }
    5668 +    3271 +    120 +
    5669 +    3272 +    121 +      let css = await finalResponse.text();
    5670 +    3273 +    122 +
    5671 +    3274 +    123 +      // Handle Vite Dev Server response (JS module instead of raw CSS)
    5672 +    3275 +    124 +      if (css.includes('const __vite__css = "')) {
    5673 +    3276 +    125 +        const match = css.match(/const __vite__css\s*=\s*"((?:[^"\\]|\\.)*)"/);
    5674 +    3277 +    126 +        if (match && match[1]) {
    5675 +    3278 +    127 +          try {
    5676 +    3279 +    128 +            // Parse JSON string to handle escapes (e.g. \n) correctly
    5677 +    3280 +    129 +            css = JSON.parse(`"${match[1]}"`);
    5678 +    3281 +    130 +          } catch (e) {
    5679 +    3282 +    131 +            console.warn('Failed to parse Vite CSS string', e);
    5680 +    3283 +    132 +          }
    5681 +    3284 +    133 +        }
    5682 +    3285 +    134 +      }
    5683 +    3286 +    135 +      return css;
    5684 +    3287 +    136 +    } catch (e) {
    5685 +    3288 +    137 +      console.error('Failed to load theme CSS', e);
    5686 +    3289 +    138 +      return '/* Theme Fetch Failed: ' + e.message + ' */';
    5687 +    3290 +    139 +    }
    5688 +    3291 +    140 +  }
    5689 +    3292 +    141 +
    5690 +    3293 +    142 +  downloadHTML(blob, filename = 'exported-markdown.html') {
    5691 +    3294 +    143 +    const url = URL.createObjectURL(blob);
    5692 +    3295 +    144 +    const a = document.createElement('a');
    5693 +    3296 +    145 +    a.href = url;
    5694 +    3297 +    146 +    a.download = filename;
    5695 +    3298 +    147 +    a.click();
    5696 +    3299 +    148 +    URL.revokeObjectURL(url);
    5697 +    3300 +    149 +  }
    5698 +    3301 +    150 +}

150 171  
    172 +  /**
    173 +   * Helper to extract CSS from potential Vite module wrapper or raw text
    174 +   */
    175 +  extractCSS(text, baseUrl) {
    176 +    // Vite dev server serves CSS files as JS modules (import ...)
    177 +    // We need to extract the actual CSS string.
    178 +    // Typical format: "import ... \n const css = \"...\" ... export default css"
    179 +    // OR direct CSS in production build.
    180 +
    181 +    // Simple check for Vite JS module wrapper
    182 +    if (text.includes('export default') || text.includes('const css =')) {
    183 +      const match = text.match(/const\s+css\s*=\s*"([\s\S]*?)"/);
    184 +      if (match && match[1]) {
    185 +        // Unescape styling (newlines, etc)
    186 +        return match[1].replace(/\\n/g, '\n').replace(/\\"/g, '"');
    187 +      }
    188 +    }
    189 +    return text;
    190 +  }
